title: For Sale:  WTS Springfield 1911 USGI 45 ACP
postcontent:
Up for sale is a Springfield Armory 1911 USGI model, on the box it says GI .45 mil spec but I have been told that since it is an early model the "mil-spec" is not the same as current mil spec pistols from Springfield. It does not say Imbel or "made in Brazil" anywhere, but rather has the "Springfield Inc, Geneseo IL USA" on it. 

Comes with 2 mags, original box, and all that came with it. I received it in a trade and didn't care for the feel of it all that much. Has a generous estimate of 500 rounds through it, although I would not be surprised if it was closer to 300 based on its condition. 

The firearm is like new. The finish is near perfect except by the slide release from disassembly and a little on the barrel from slide movement. All internal parts are in excellent shape with little wear, if in need of a little cleaning. Disassembly is still very stiff from the like new parts. I have personally fired 14 rounds through it to test for function with no problems. It is also very accurate. At 50 Yards (we have no pistol range) 12 of the shots hit a 24-18" paper. This was also the first time I had ever fired 1911 style pistol so your accuracy may be better.

Price is $450 FTF or add $25 to ship

title: For Sale:  TM style CYMA Glock 18c AEP. Tuned insides. Auto and semi. Battery powered. Really high RoF.
postcontent:
First off. This is a great airsoft gun for kids. It doesn't shoot fast enough to hurt anyone really, but you still need safety glasses. 

Also, this is not a walmart gun. Walmart guns are generally plasitc, low performance and cannot compete with real full metal airsoft guns. I've used this glock to win many games and it hasn't failed me yet. I've been the walmart route only to have it break with no parts to fix it. This gun is fairly common, so parts are easy to find and relitively cheap, so you get what you pay for so to speak.

title: For Sale:  WTS Springfield 1903 A3 Remington
postcontent:
Up for sale is a Springfield 1903 A3 in near perfect condition. 

The bore is in pristine condition, extremely shiny and no corrosion. The 4 groove rifling is perfect with sharp edges, and the grooves show no buildup where they meet the rifling. The barrel is practically brand new and still has the lines from the initial broach cutting.

All the visible bolt components, including the cutoff switch, have an R on them indicating Remington parts like the rest of the rifle. There is also an R on the front muzzle band, front sight base, and the barrel is also remington and may be original. as it was made in 8-43. 

The parkerizing on the firearm is in near perfect shape no fading or noticable wear. The bluing on the bolt is a perfect black worn only from operating the action. The bolt face is the same. The peripheral parts, such as the barrel bands, floor plate, and end cap exhibit a little more wear. The barrel bands still retain most of their bluing with some combat scrapes present. 

Overall in excellent shape with only a couple of dings in the stock. There is very little wear present on the action. The metal finish is also nearly perfect with only a bit more wear on the peripherals such as the barrel bands. If I remember correctly it was made around 1943.

$25 Shipping insurance extra
Cash or postal money order only

title: For Sale:  Mosin Nagant 2-7x32B Scout Scope Kit
postcontent:
FREE SHIPPING TO ANY US ADDRESS . . . . . . . 

Includes: 2-7x32MM Variable Power Wide Angle Scout Scope with Duplex Reticle, “No Gunsmith” Cross Bolt Picatinny Rail Scope Mount, and Low Profile Scope Rings.

Scope Specifications:
+ Manufactured by Aim Sports Inc
+ Magnification: Wide Angle 2~7 Variable Power
+ Duplex Reticle
+ Objective Lens: 32mm
+ One Inch Tube
+ Weight: 9.0 Ounces
+ Length: 10 3/8 inches
+ Extended Eye Relief
+ Matte Black Finish
+ Windage/Elevation: 1 Click = 1/4" @100 Yards
+ Multi-Coated Lenses
+ Bright Optics
+ Sharp Focusing
+ Eye Piece Focus Lock Ring
+ Nitrogen Filled - Fog and Water Proof
+ Shock Proof – Heavy Duty Recoil Design
+ Protective Lens Caps Included
+ New in Box 
**Limited Lifetime Warranty 

Mount Specifications:
+ New Third Generation Scout Scope Mount.  
+ Fits Mosin Nagant 7.62x54R Rifles and Carbines. 
+ For Russian, Hungarian and Polish Carbine Models 38 and 44, Finnish Models M27, M28 and Chinese Model 53 with the 2 3/8" Long 1000 Meter Graduated Rear Sight
+ For Rifle Models 91, 91/30, 91/38 and 91/59 with the 3 3/8" Long 2000 Meter Graduated Rear Site
+ Will Fit Finland 7.62x53R M91/30 but not other models. Some Finnish M91/30 rifles have a high handguard and may require higher rings
+ Easy Installation - "No Gunsmithing" Mount Replaces Rear Sight and Bolts into the Rear Sight Base (Note: Some minor fitting may be required)
+ Use with Weaver Style Rings
+ For Extended Eye Relief (EER) Scopes, Hologram and Red Dot Sights
+ Hardened Aluminum Mount with Multiple Picatinny Rail Slots
+ Mounting Hardware and Installation Instructions Included
+ Restore Rifle to Original Configuration by Removing Mount and Reinstalling the Rear Sight

** This new scope mount has been designed to provide lower "visual alignment" mounting for scout scopes. Alloy steel cross bolt mounting to the rear sight base with a locking nut provides a secure installation and insures that this mount will not shoot loose.

The easily installed, "no gunsmithing" mount replaces the rear sight leaf. (Detailed installation instructions are included with the mount). Simply remove the rear sight leaf and leaf spring, then insert and bolt in the scout mount. Attach the included Weaver style rings to the Picatinny mount and install the extended eye relief (EER) scout scope. You can restore the rifle to its original configuration by unbolting the scope and mount and reinstalling the rear sight.

Some Mosin Nagant scope mounts were designed with two short bolts that attach through the side “ears” of the rear sight base and thread into the scope mount.  With extended shooting these bolts strip out the threads in the aluminum scope mount and the mount comes loose. Our mount has been threaded completely through and is fitted with a full length threaded alloy steel cross bolt and retaining nut that securely attaches the scope mount to the rear sight base. 

Ring Specifications:
+ Strong Lightweight Aluminum
+ Non-Slip Mounting
+ Matte Black Finish
+ Low Profile
+ One Inch Diameter
+ New in Box
+ Fits Weaver Style Bases or Picatinny Rail

title: For Sale/Trade:  CZ-70 .32 ACP Czech Police 1972 CZ70 32 Automatic
location: CZ-70 .32 ACP Czech 1972 CZ70 32 Automatic, Tennessee, United States
postcontent:
Our # HG0073. This listing is for ONE pistol, the exact one in the photo. FFLS and police departments, however, may take any number of very similar CZ-70s at the same per-pistol price, and with no additional shipping charges. This pistol served and protected the good citizens of Ostrava, Czech Republic, with the Ostrava Municipal Police for the final years of the Cold War, with Soviet Interference, and during the first decade of a free Czech Republic. 1972 date code is stamped upper left side of slide, as the photos show, next to the Czech military proof mark. During the period of manufacture and issue the Czech Police were dealing with a good many Balkan terrorists; most important, however, was Vaclav Havel’s early underground leadership. Right side of slide is neatly stamped by the importer, PW Arms of Redmond, WA, as required by Federal Law. The CZ-70, or VZ-70 in Czech terminology, is a descendant of the Wartime CZ-27, very close kin in appearance, construction, and even quality to the Walther PPK/S. Left side slide bears CZ Factory Markings Vzor 70 cal. 7.65 / Made in Czechoslovakia. This fine little pistol is all steel, traditional double- and single-action with main lever safety and internal firing pin safety. The main safety serves as a decocker; yet the trigger-hammer system operates without firing while the safety is on, so the pistol will carry cocked and locked for single action first shot readiness and then stay ready for double action firing simply by raising the safety lever. Overall extreme length is 6 5/8 inches, from the muzzle to the back of the upper grip frame. Sight radius is 5 inches, with stake-on half moon low profile front sight separated from the dovetailed notch drift-adjustable-only rear sight by a very nicely serrated rib on top of the slide. Slide thickness is .868 inches; .925 if one measures the checkered serration disassembly bar on the right side of the frame. Lower rear area of the slide is serrated, as the photos show. Trigger is serrated face .312 width, with .295 serrated Commander / PPK Style hammer. Magazine capacity is 9 + 1 rounds of .32 ACP ammunition, 7.65 Browning in European terminology. Weight empty is a solid 23.8 ounces. Trigger pull is a manageable 15 pound vicinity on double action, and 7-8 pound range on single action. Grips are original issue polymer CZ with CZ factory logo, Czeska Zbrojovka, logo on the right panel. Barrel is 3 1/2 inch with 1:10 conventional rifling. This is one of the easiest pistols ever to field strip and clean, by means of the slide release button on the slide, even simpler than their PPK relatives. Surface detractions are moderate, with substantial amounts of original bluing mixed with holster contact and carry scouring. We rate this CZ-70 as Good, 60 to 70 percent vicinity by our estimate; photos, however, ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. It is Excellent Mechanically; Bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright, clean, and excellent on this pistol. Replacement pricing on current production CZ-USA Pistols is always $400 - $ 500 range. We’re offering the CZ 70 in the photos, however, for only $ 169.00.	Not transferable to civilians in California, District of Colombia,  Massachusetts, or New York City.	Not C&R Eligible.	We are in stock on plenty of .32 ACP Ammo, 30 cents a round / $15 per 50 box price area.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> $10 lower 48; $30 Alaska, Hawaii or Puerto Rico, USPS Priority Mail, insured with Delivery Confirmation. Don’t let your buddies use your account, that kind of thing smells like felony level straw purchase attempt. MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped same day. 7 day hold on checks.  FFL ok by fax, e-mail or mail, please ask your dealer to put your name on there. We offer 7 day money back on used guns and items, but No Returns on New in Box guns or on Lay-aways or ammo. We do not pay transfer fees or return shipping. We accept lay-away with 20% down, balance in 90 days, lay aways not refundable. Internet phone hours 8:30 – 4:30 CST Mon - Fri CST. Local pickup available. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340 We Buy, Sell, or Trade. We always have, since 1952.

title: For Sale:  Schwarzlose Model 1898
postcontent:
The Schwarzlose Model 1898 was a semi-automatic pistol invented by Prussian firearm designer Andreas Wilhelm Schwarzlose. It was chambered for cartridges such as the 7.65x25mm Borchardt and 7.63x25mm Mauser.
The Schwarzlose design was advanced for its time, but not widely adopted. Small lots were sold to the Boers during the Boer War. Another lot was sold to members of the Russian Social-Democratic Party who were plotting insurrection, but were confiscated at the Russian border and issued to the Imperial Russian Frontier Guards.

Feel free to make an offer.

title: For Sale/Trade:  CZ-70 .32 ACP Czech 1973 CZ70 32 Automatic
location: CZ-70 .32 ACP Czech 1973 CZ70 32 Automatic, Tennessee, United States
postcontent: Our # HG0165. This listing is for ONE pistol, the exact one in the photo. This pistol served and protected the good citizens of Ostrava, Czech Republic, with the Ostrava Municipal Police for the final years of the Cold War, with Soviet Interference, and during the first decade of a free Czech Republic. 1973 date code is stamped upper left side of slide, as the photos show, next to the Czech military proof mark. During the period of manufacture and issue the Czech Police were dealing with a good many Balkan terrorists; most important, however, was Vaclav Havel’s early underground leadership. Right side of slide is neatly stamped by the importer, PW Arms of Redmond, WA, as required by Federal Law. The CZ-70, or VZ-70 in Czech terminology, is a descendant of the Wartime CZ-27, very close kin in appearance, construction, and even quality to the Walther PPK/S. Left side slide bears CZ Factory Markings Vzor 70 cal. 7.65 / Made in Czechoslovakia. This fine little pistol is all steel, traditional double- and single-action with main lever safety and internal firing pin safety. The main safety serves as a decocker; yet the trigger-hammer system operates without firing while the safety is on, so the pistol will carry cocked and locked for single action first shot readiness and then stay ready for double action firing simply by raising the safety lever. Overall extreme length is 6 5/8 inches, from the muzzle to the back of the upper grip frame. Sight radius is 5 inches, with stake-on half moon low profile front sight separated from the dovetailed notch drift-adjustable-only rear sight by a very nicely serrated rib on top of the slide. Slide thickness is .868 inches; .925 if one measures the checkered serration disassembly bar on the right side of the frame. Lower rear area of the slide is serrated, as the photos show. Trigger is serrated face .312 width, with .295 serrated Commander / PPK Style hammer. Magazine capacity is 9 + 1 rounds of .32 ACP ammunition, 7.65 Browning in European terminology. Weight empty is a solid 23.8 ounces. Trigger pull is a manageable 15 pound vicinity on double action, and 7-8 pound range on single action. Grips are original issue polymer CZ with CZ factory logo, Czeska Zbrojovka, logo on the right panel. Barrel is 3 1/2 inch with 1:10 conventional rifling. This is one of the easiest pistols ever to field strip and clean, by means of the slide release button on the slide, even simpler than their PPK relatives. Surface detractions are moderate, with substantial amounts of original bluing mixed with holster contact and carry scouring. We rate this CZ-70 as Good, 60 to 70 percent vicinity by our estimate; photos, however, ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. It is Excellent Mechanically; Bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright, clean, and excellent on this pistol. Replacement pricing on current production CZ-USA Pistols is always $400 - $ 500 range.
